caption_text: MBR confiyuration and operation A tube and shell MBR configuration is used, and shown in Fig. 3. The tube consists of a closed-end porous or-alumina membrane. The catalyst (1.7g) is packed in the annular region around the membrane.
raw_window: MBR confiyuration and operation A tube and shell MBR configuration is used, and shown in Fig. 3.
The tube consists of a closed-end porous or-alumina membrane.
The catalyst (1.7g) is packed in the annular region around the membrane.

caption_text: The annular catalyst-packed bed is supported by a custom-made quartz tube (see Fig. 3). A quartz frit, located 35.5 cm from the top of the tube, centers the membrane within the module and within the hot zone. An annular thermocouple trough is attached to the quartz tube and encircles the catalyst region.
raw_window: The annular catalyst-packed bed is supported by a custom-made quartz tube (see Fig. 3).
A quartz frit, located 35.5 cm from the top of the tube, centers the membrane within the module and within the hot zone.
An annular thermocouple trough is attached to the quartz tube and encircles the catalyst region.

caption_text: The results presented in Fig. 5 are typical for most runs. In general, temper- ature rises on the order of 1-3 K are observed on the shell side and 3-6 K temperature rises are measured inside the membrane. The temperature rises are fairly uniform in the axial direction, with variations usually less than 1 K.
raw_window: The results presented in Fig. 5 are typical for most runs.
In general, temper- ature rises on the order of 1-3 K are observed on the shell side and 3-6 K temperature rises are measured inside the membrane.
The temperature rises are fairly uniform in the axial direction, with variations usually less than 1 K.

caption_text: For the reaction data presented in Fig. 5, average temperature rises of 3 K and 1 K at the inner mem- brane radius and outer quartz tube, respectively, are measured. Temperature rises of 4.8 and 1.2K at the inner and outer radius of the annular catalyst bed, respectively, are calculated by eqs (12) and (13). The heat flow (Q ~ 4.2 J/s) is calculated by multiplying the molar ethane flowrate by the product of the individual reaction molar extent and AH~ summed over each reaction.
raw_window: For the reaction data presented in Fig. 5, average temperature rises of 3 K and 1 K at the inner mem- brane radius and outer quartz tube, respectively, are measured.
Temperature rises of 4.8 and 1.2K at the inner and outer radius of the annular catalyst bed, respectively, are calculated by eqs (12) and (13).
The heat flow (Q ~ 4.2 J/s) is calculated by multiplying the molar ethane flowrate by the product of the individual reaction molar extent and AH~ summed over each reaction.

caption_text: Table 1 lists those conditions that produced periodic flames.
raw_window: Table 1 lists those conditions that produced periodic flames.
Similar behavior has been reported for the oxida- tion/combustion of ethane in a flow reactor in the temperature regime near 873 K (Choudhary and Ra- jput, 1995).
The authors observed both temperature and composition oscillations in time, but do not re- port flames.
table_reason: Only S0 mentions the table and describes its content, while S1 and S2 provide external references and observations not part of the caption.

caption_text: Table 1. Tubular reactor experiments which produced periodic counterpropagating blue flames Ethane to Temperature Residence oxygen Pressure surge (psig) Frequency (s) of flame (K) time (s) ratio with flame ignition ignition 863 2 1 0.3 Not recorded 863 4 0.5 Observed, but not recorded 873 2 1 2 3 873 4 0.5 6 17 883 1 0.5 3 5 883 2 0.5 4.5 8 883 4 0.25 2 16.7 883 4 0.5 No discernible pattern No discernible pattern (varies between 0.5 and 6) (varies between 6.2 and 21.3) 903 1 0.25 6 903 1 0.5 6, 6, 6, 6, 4, 0.5, 0.5, 0,5, 0.5, 0.5~, ~ 2.2 (varies from 2.1 to 2.5) 903 1 l (doublet) (During start-up only) set of experiments, care was taken to remove all fines in the catalyst, and the initial pressure drop reduced to 0.5 psig.
raw_window: Table 1.

Tubular reactor experiments which produced periodic counterpropagating blue flames Ethane to Temperature Residence oxygen Pressure surge (psig) Frequency (s) of flame (K) time (s) ratio with flame ignition ignition 863 2 1 0.3 Not recorded 863 4 0.5 Observed, but not recorded 873 2 1 2 3 873 4 0.5 6 17 883 1 0.5 3 5 883 2 0.5 4.5 8 883 4 0.25 2 16.7 883 4 0.5 No discernible pattern No discernible pattern (varies between 0.5 and 6) (varies between 6.2 and 21.3) 903 1 0.25 6 903 1 0.5 6, 6, 6, 6, 4, 0.5, 0.5, 0,5, 0.5, 0.5~, ~ 2.2 (varies from 2.1 to 2.5) 903 1 l (doublet) (During start-up only) set of experiments, care was taken to remove all fines in the catalyst, and the initial pressure drop reduced to 0.5 psig.
Slight changes in catalyst composition or phase, or the initial reaction pressure or temperature may account for the lower pressure surges in the second set of experiments.
